newsitem.title: ROMANIA: ROMANIA AVERAGE MONTHLY NET WAGES DOWN IN MAY.
newsitem.headline: ROMANIA AVERAGE MONTHLY NET WAGES DOWN IN MAY.

text.p: The average monthly net wage in Romania slipped by 4.1 percent in May from the previous month, but was 93.4 percent up year on year, National Statistics Board (CNS) data showed.
The CNS said purchasing power was 8.1 percent down in May from the previous month and 29.4 percent lower than last May.
Monthly inflation was 4.3 percent in May, slower than 6.9 percent in April.
Employees in the financial and banking sector had the highest net wage of 1.39 million lei, while hotel and restaurant staff was paid the worst -- 392,110 lei per month.
Romania employed 5.529 million people at end-April, 26,000 up from the previous month, following more marked rises in the number of employees in the farming and construction sectors.
